review_text: This house is a great fit for a family, group of friends, or a couple of families. Plenty of space, beds, and bathrooms, has been updated, and was clean. The house is off a fairly busy street, but the road noise is minimal for the most part. We didn't even have any issues sleeping in the front bedroom, but you do occasionally hear louder vehicles (motorcycles and large trucks primarily) while in the home. You may have to wait to get out for traffic sometimes as well. We enjoyed hanging out in the basement with the massage chair, playing air hockey, and watching movies after spending time at the beach or museums in town. As another reviewer mentioned, the only TV is in the basement. Not a huge deal, but I had missed that detail in the info. The home had several toiletries available if you wanted to use them (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, etc) we had our own, but it was nice to have an option if you forgot or ran out. I also did a fair amount of laundry since we went swimming most days and it was nice having the washer/dryer and supplies if you wanted to use them (laundry soap, bleach, fabric softener, etc) We found the beds to be firmer than we prefer, but others may appreciate that. We didn't do much cooking, but I saw pots, pans, cookie sheets, along with all the dishes and silverware. The one big thing I wanted to note was the stairs to the 2nd floor are fairly steep and narrow, which wasn't noticeable in the pictures. It wasn't an issue for us, but older adults or young children are likely to be more of a concern. Rigoberto was quick to respond to questions that came up and kind when a dish was accidently broken. Overall we had a great trip and enjoyed the home!

review_text:
Rigoberto's place is such a charm! We stayed here for a disc golf tournament last week and were blown away by the gorgeous remodelling and decorating he had done, since it's clearly an older home. Everything was clean, neat, and tidy. There's a smart thermostat with a QR code that helps you quickly get connected to wifi (such a nice touch!). The first floor bathroom is gorgeous, the front room is so cozy (that couch is to die for!) and the sun room off of the main house was such a joy to read in. There are two bedrooms on the first floor and one is right off the front of the house. If you're a light sleeper and staying in the front bedroom, you may want to consider earplugs since there is quite a bit of traffic between 4-6 a.m during the week. The upstairs bedrooms are surprisingly very large, and the en suite master bathroom with a barn door is magical. Something to note: the mattresses are very soft so if you're sharing a bed, you and your partner will sink into the middle.
The Smart TV is downstairs in the basement, and we were blown away by how great the surround sound is (definitely a movie theater experience!). The massage chair was such a hit, especially for all the guys playing in the tournament. There is a bathroom down there as well, but there isn't a mirror so definitely a function only bathroom. We also had a blast playing with the air hockey table and the Foosball table.
Something that we didn't consider was the fact that there isn't a dishwasher, so if you're staying with a larger group you might want to consider picking up paper plates if you don't want to do a ton of dishes. The house is also situated off of a main street with a single-car long driveway, so if you're staying with multiple people, you'll have to do some car shuffling. Also, the backyard is definitely not a hang-out spot since the yard is pretty overgrown. There are plenty of other places to hang, but it would have been nice to have a fire during the summer nights.
Something the listing doesn't say which is a TOTAL positive: It's within walking distance of the Aquatic center which is essentially a mini water park and has a mini golf course. If were we had more time, we were definitely checking it out! Adults are 7 dollars and children 3-17 are 6 dollars for admission. There's also a charming bookstore within walking distance and a coffee and ice cream shop a little more down the way. We would definitely stay here again!
